instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKL_SW: What is BKL_SW? BKL_SW means “BACKLIGHT SWITCH” – DC to DC boost circuits increase voltage by putting a lower voltage, like 8 volts, through an inductor. On the other side of the inductor, it is switched to ground rapidly - on this side, you will end up with an increased voltage as a result of the switching. BKL_SW usually refers to the pin on the LED driver that is attached to the inductor. .
definitions.BKL_FB: What is BKL_FB? This is backlight feedback. It goes from the output of the backlight circuit back to the LED driver, so it can see what it is doing. If this line is broken or corroded, the boost circuit will not boost PPBUS_G3H to a higher voltage for backlight, and backlight voltage output will be the same as the PPBUS_G3H input. This trace/via is usually the first to corrode since it is the highest voltage in the system..
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PLT_RST: What is PLT_RST?  PLT_RST stands for platform reset. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No back light, Video yes.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No back light, Video yes.
- <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> - 0V
- <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_DIV</SIGNAL> - 12.2v
- F9700 is fine and has 12.6V on both sides
- <SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_BKLT</SIGNAL> - 0v
- <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> - 0v
- <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL>  not present
- <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> Pin 1:  0v
- <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> Pin 2:  0v
- Pin 1 of LCD connector has  0v
- <RESISTOR>R9753</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R9757</RESISTOR> are both good and have continuity to <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>
- <SIGNAL>BKL_SW</SIGNAL> -  0v
- <SIGNAL>BKL_FB</SIGNAL> -  0v

threads.message: That seems very unlikely. Did you measure those with an LCD connected?

[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No back light, Video yes.
threads.message: with LCD connected [LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=Arial][SIZE=12px]<SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> is [/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT][SIZE=14px][LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=Arial]0V[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT][/SIZE][LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=Arial][SIZE=12px] and <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> is  [/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT][SIZE=14px][LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=Arial]3V.[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT][/SIZE]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No back light, Video yes.
threads.message: The display is tested working? Do you have other display to test???

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No back light, Video yes.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No back light, Video yes.
threads.message:
with LCD connected 
<SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> is 
0V
and <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> is 
3V.

<SIGNAL>PLT_RST</SIGNAL> has always been high, there is no way for the board to boot without that being present. That means your measurements were not correct.

Are you 100% sure there is video on the LCD? Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No back light, Video yes.
threads.message: my display has liquid damage , power cable burn , jump the wire and now working. Thanks for helping.
